intro: Psychotria kirkii var. volkensii, commonly known as the African morning glory, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical contexts.
